caption:
Table 1: Comparison of training sets. Ours has large variations in 
pose, expression and background.

Table 2: Comparison of existing benchmark datasets. iBugMask has 
large variations in pose, expression and background.
Table 3: Results on iBugMask. F1 scores are reported in percentage. Eyebrows, eyes, lips and inner mouth are merged to Inner Parts.

Table 4: Performance of our model with different pre-processing 
methods. F1 scores are reported in percentage.

Table 5: The effectiveness of HybridBlock in different stages of the 
backbone. F1 scores in percentage are reported.

Table 7: Effectiveness of the pose-augmented training set iBugMask-train. Baseline models use crop-and-resize for pre-processing. The mean F1 
scores are reported (in percentage).

Table 8: Comparison with state-of-the-art methods on LFW-PL. F1 
scores for each region and the overall pixel accuracy are reported.

Table 9: Efficiency comparison between four methods: FCN, 
Deeplabv3+, SPNet and ours. Input images are of size (512, 512, 3). 
Models are profiled on the same machine and values are the mean of 
100 runs. Lower values indicate better efficiency. Our model is more 
efficient in the number of parameters and FLOPS. M stands for 
Million, GMac for Giga Multiply-accumulate operations, ms for 
milliseconds.
Table 10: Comparison with state-of-the-art methods on Helen. F1 scores are reported in percentage. Bold values are for the best results.
